name: Bealtaine Theatre Festival 2025
description:
We are excited to present a vibrant festival celebrating cultural exchange between Ireland and Canada. Enjoy bold theatre, music, and storytelling as creativity takes center stage.

Festival Highlights:

The King of All Birds (Apr 25-27) - A unique performance blending song, vocoder, and film collage to explore humanity's fascination with flight.

Tom Moran is a Big Fat Filthy Disgusting Liar (May 2-3) - A funny and heartfelt solo show on masculinity, childhood, and secrets.

Story of a Day – Scéal Lae (May 17-18) - A magical, music-filled exploration of everyday moments, perfect for kids.

The Libravian (May 24-25) - A whimsical adventure through stories of bravery for young audiences.

name: Saturday Mingling: Live Music with Andean Music Band Rimay Canada
description:
Join us for a lively evening of music and connection! We're excited to welcome Rimay Canada, an Andean music group that has been sharing the rich traditions of Ecuadorian folk music for over 20 years. Their performances bring together multiple generations of musicians, creating a vibrant atmosphere that celebrates Andean culture. Get your tickets now and don't miss out on this special evening of live music and great company!

This Mingling event is part of Jamii's April cycle, guided by lead artist Carolina Rojas, and centred around the theme of the Chakana, an ancestral Andean symbol representing the connection between the spiritual, earthly, and inner realms.

organizer.name: CCA, TAC, TD Ready Commitment, Metcalf Foundation, Rama Gaming House, Charitable Gaming

name: L'Amoreaux North Park Tree Planting Event

address.streetAddress: McNicoll Ave at Silver Springs Blvd

description:
Help expand the forested area near the pond at beautiful L'Amoreaux North Park by planting native trees and shrubs. 

Event site conditions vary. Contact us for more information including accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.
